Detailed Description

A Context Device for a window.

This class is derived from CDCT. It calls the Windows GetWindowDC function at construction time and ReleaseDC function at destruction time. This means that a CWindowDC object accesses the entire screen area of a window, both client and nonclient areas.

Definition at line 2701 of file atlgdi.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

WTL::CWindowDC::CWindowDC (  HWND    hWnd )  [inline]
 

Constructor.

This constructor creates and instance of a CWindowDC object that accesses the entire screen area, both client and nonclient, of the window to by hWnd. The constructor calls the Windows GetDC function.

Parameters:
hWnd  A Window handle.

Definition at line 2708 of file atlgdi.h.

References WTL::CDCT< true >::m_hDC, and m_hWnd.

WTL::CWindowDC::~CWindowDC (    )  [inline]
 

Destructor.

The destructor call the Windows ReleaseDC function.

Definition at line 2714 of file atlgdi.h.

Member Data Documentation

WTL::CWindowDC::m_hWnd
 

The Context Device's Window handle.

This data member contains the window handle to the window used to construct the CWindowDC object. The m_hWnd data member is a variable of type HWND.

Note:
The following sample shows how to use the class. 
// Get a dc for a CWnd object pointer.
CWindowDC dc(m_hWnd);
// Send my private massage.
::SendMessage(m_hWnd, WM_MYMESSAGE, 0, 0);

Referenced by CWindowDC(), and ~CWindowDC().
